sys_properties_category.name: OPEN AI Properties
sys_properties_category.title:
OpenAI provides a suite of APIs that allow users to generate text, translate text, and generate text completions using machine learning models. When making a request to one of these APIs, there are several attributes that can be included in the request to customize the behavior of the API. Here is a list of some of the common request attributes that are available:

  • model: Specifies the machine learning model that should be used to generate the text. OpenAI offers a range of models with different capabilities and performance characteristics, so you can choose the one that best meets your needs.
  • prompt: Specifies the text prompt that the API should use as a starting point for generating text. This can be a single word, a sentence, or a longer piece of text, depending on the specific API and the desired output.
  • max_tokens: Specifies the maximum number of tokens (i.e., words and punctuation) that the API should generate in its response. This can be useful for limiting the length of the generated text, or for ensuring that the API doesn't generate too much text in cases where the generated text is being displayed to a user.
  • top_p: Specifies the proportion of the mass of the probability distribution over the vocabulary that the API should consider when generating text. This can be used to control the "creativity" of the generated text, with higher values resulting in more predictable text and lower values resulting in more creative and varied text.
  • temperature: Specifies the temperature parameter for the sampling process that the API uses to generate text. Higher temperature values result in more creative and varied text, while lower values result in more predictable text.
  • num_return_sequences: Specifies the number of sequences that the API should generate in its response. This can be useful for generating multiple alternative versions of the same text prompt, or for generating a sequence of related text prompts.
  • stop: Specifies a string or list of strings that the API should use as a stopping point when generating text. When the API encounters one of these strings in the generated text, it will stop generating text and return the generated text up to that point.
